definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Skeptics say Chinese bank stocks might not recover their lost ground.
sentences.chinese: 懷疑論者認爲，中資銀行股或許無法收復失地。

sentences.english: Major European indexes erased early morning losses.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲幾大股指早盤收復失地。

sentences.english: After the term of the armistice expired in 1590, Russian troops moved in to take them back.
sentences.chinese: 在1590年停戰期滿後，露西亞軍隊揮師收復失地。

definition: to lose what one has just obtained (idiom)
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
(of a stock price or market index) currently higher than at the previous day's close
NASDAQ/National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations, a computerized data system to provide brokers with price quotations for securities traded over the counter
loud songs reaches the clouds (idiom); fig. to praise to the skies
